<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/30/apples-airtags-go-sale?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
AirTag, Your Keys Are It
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Apple AirTag" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80OTMwL2FwcGxlX2FpcnRhZy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The smallest and least powerful item in Apple’s device lineup, the humble AirTag, went on sale yesterday. But techies <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/04/28/technology/personaltech/apple-airtag-review-tile.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">are hyped</a> that this runt of the litter made its debut. Why? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For one, if second-gen iPod Shuffles taught us anything, it’s that sometimes Apple’s smallest, simplest products change our lives the most. The $29 AirTags attach to items via a $35 key ring (or off-brand option) to let iOS users quickly locate lost keys, wallets, and dogs (knock on wood x3). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sound familiar? That’s because Tile devices have been doing the same thing for about eight years. In fact, Tile’s CEO CJ Prober threw another <a href="https://www.vox.com/recode/22395840/apple-airtags-tile-tracker-antitrust-regulators?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">antitrust allegation</a> on Apple’s pile after AirTags were officially announced last week, requesting that Congress “take a closer look.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But if motivational posters are to be believed, it’s not what you do but how you do it. And Apple finds your dog differently than Tile does... </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Introducing “ultra-wideband”</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Good for pandemic sweatpants; even better for locating lost items. While Tile finds devices using Bluetooth signals, each AirTag is equipped with an ultra-wideband chip that allows owners to track them down with <a href="https://www.wired.com/story/apple-airtags-future-of-augmented-reality/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">much more precision</a> than Bluetooth can. Using an iPhone 11 or a later model, users will be able to see visual cues that let them know that, for instance, their phone isn’t just on the bed, but has nestled into the Neverland of their duvet. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Where things get even cooler: </strong>That kind of advanced location-finding could be the first ripple in a wave of new augmented reality. Bouncing all those signals between iOS devices and AirTags could create “a hidden digital layer” of the world, Stanford researcher Gordon Wetzstein told Wired. And that layer could make AR experiences, like playing <em>Pokémon GO</em> or having the Snapchat hot dog dance on your desk, more realistic. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Ultra-wideband may </span><span><a href="https://techcrunch.com/2021/01/05/tile-to-launch-to-launch-a-new-tracker-powered-by-ultra-wideband-technology/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">not stay unique</a></span><span> to Apple, since Tile is reportedly working on its own device using the technology. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Apple hasn’t commented on the augmented reality possibilities of AirTags. However, AirTags were created using Apple’s AR-building software platform, ARKit, and the tech company’s shown interest in the space before: Just open your Measure app for an early example. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ While we’re here: </strong>AirTags represent another instance of Apple building an ecosystem of products and services that work together in ways that could be construed as unfair. Yesterday, the EU issued <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/4/30/22407376/apple-european-union-antitrust-charges-app-store-music-competition-commission-margrethe-vestager?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">antitrust charges</a> against Apple over its App Store practices.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/30/vaccine-tracker-may-1?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Vaccine Tracker
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/30/vaccine-tracker-may-1" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Vaccine tracker" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MzcxL3ZhY2NpbmVfdHJhY2tlci5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">In the US...</strong>more than half of US adults have received at least one dose, but the <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/04/30/covid-vaccinations-in-us-are-slowing-as-supply-outstrips-demand.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">slowdown is real</a>: The US is averaging 2.6 million vaccinations per day compared to the peak of 3.4 million on April 13.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Around the world...</strong>174 countries, including the US, have administered <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/covid-vaccine-tracker-global-distribution/?sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more than 1.1 billion shots</a> in total. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The latest headlines</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">A “breaking point” in India: </strong>As the country grapples with a healthcare crisis, the country’s largest city, Mumbai, <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/mumbai-closes-covid-vaccine-centers-india-s-health-services-buckle-n1265930?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">closed 94 vaccination centers</a> for three days because there aren’t enough doses to go around. India is reporting nearly 400,000 Covid-19 cases daily.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Vaccine $$$: </strong>AstraZeneca said its Covid-19 vaccine brought in <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/live/2021/04/30/world/covid-vaccine-coronavirus-cases?utm_source=morning_brew#virus-astrazeneca-vaccine-revenue" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$275 million in revenue</a> in the first quarter, most of which came from Europe because it’s not yet authorized in the US. That represents about 4% of its total revenue; the company’s blockbuster cancer drug Tagrisso did over $1.1 billion in sales last quarter.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/30/soccer-clubs-go-silent-social-media-raise-awareness-online-harassment?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
English Soccer Goes Silent on Social Media
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/30/soccer-clubs-go-silent-social-media-raise-awareness-online-harassment" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="LEICESTER, ENGLAND - DECEMBER 26: Trent Alexander-Arnold takes a corner ..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80OTI3L2xlaWNlc3Rlcl9jaXR5X3ZfbGl2ZXJwb28uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Michael Regan/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On a typical weekend, social media platforms light up with highlights, commentary, and reactions to a full slate of English soccer games. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This weekend will be much quieter. The most powerful stakeholders in English soccer will <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/04/24/sports/soccer/soccer-racism-boycott.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">black out</a> their social media accounts to raise awareness over racism and harassment online. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>They include England’s top men’s and women’s soccer leagues, governing agencies like FIFA and UEFA, and broadcasters Sky Sports and BT Sport.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Other leagues, including English cricket, Premiership Rugby, and lawn tennis, are also </span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/sports/2021/04/30/soccer-social-media-blackout/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">taking part</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Online abuse is rampant in European soccer, where Black players and female analysts are often the subjects of a flood of racist and sexist messages. The anti-racism group Kick It Out reported a <a href="https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/kick-it-out-rise-reports-discrimination-football-a9702666.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">42% rise</a> in reports of discrimination within professional soccer last season. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In February, executives of England’s top leagues sent a letter to Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey and Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg, asking them to <a href="https://www.efl.com/news/2021/february/english-footballs-open-letter-to-social-media/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">take measures</a> to stop the “relentless flow of racist and discriminatory messages” that breed on their platforms.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The social media blackout movement was sparked by former Arsenal star Thierry Henry, who deleted his social media accounts in March to take a stand against abuse.</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">

</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>About 2.7 million Americans are <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-04-30/more-americans-are-considering-retirement-because-of-covid?sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">considering retirement</a> earlier than they planned, which Bloomberg attributes to mostly white boomers having saved up during the pandemic and looking to “get out while the getting’s good.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“What we need is a 4-winged chicken.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A representative of the North Carolina Poultry Federation bemoaned the <a href="https://www.wsoctv.com/news/local/what-we-need-is-4-winged-chicken-restaurants-experiencing-chicken-wing-shortage/FWL3DAFY2VADZNYGPIOHQER2SM/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">current shortage</a> of chicken wings to WSOC-TV.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>What is “Cheugy”? (<a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/04/29/style/cheugy.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">New York Times</a>)</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/30/five-guys-favorite-horse-kentucky-derby-dream?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Five Guys, Their Favorite Horse, and a Kentucky Derby Dream
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/30/hot-rod-charlie-five-best-human-friends-big-kentucky-derby-dreams" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Six men celebrating their horses win and heading to the Kentucky Derby" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80OTE3L2hvdF9yb2RfY2hhcmxpZS5qcGVnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Patrick O'Neill</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In every good horse movie—<em>Seabiscuit</em>, <em>Hidalgo</em>, <em>Racing Stripes</em>—there’s a brooding protagonist who, throughout everything, believes the horse can win. In this story, there are five protagonists. And they’re less brooding.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Reiley Higgins, Patrick O’Neill, Alex Quoyeser, Eric Armagost, and Dan Giovacchini are friends who met on the Brown football team and wanted to find something they could all do together after graduating in 2014. Five years later, they decided to form Boat Racing LLC—an ode to the classic (?) drinking game—to invest in racehorses. After their first two horses, they found Hot Rod Charlie, the horse that currently has the <a href="https://www.cbssports.com/general/news/kentucky-derby-2021-odds-post-positions-legendary-expert-who-nailed-tiz-the-law-gives-surprising-picks/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fourth-best odds</a> to win the Kentucky Derby today.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Read Hot Rod Charlie’s and the boys’ <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/30/hot-rod-charlie-five-best-human-friends-big-kentucky-derby-dreams?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">full story here</a>.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">

GAMES
</h3>
</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/30/brew-crossword-little-birdie-told" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Crossword" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yOTk5L2Nyb3Nzd29yZC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Today’s puzzle is...not easy, but honestly just being in the virtual presence of a master clue writer like Glen Anderson is enjoyment enough.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/30/brew-crossword-little-birdie-told?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Solve the puzzle</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Think <span class="il">you</span> have what it takes to make your own crossword? </strong><span class="il">Spoiler</span>: <span class="il">You</span> <span class="il">do</span>. <a href="https://link.morningbrew.com/click/23199581.17679/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cubW9ybmluZ2JyZXcuY29tL2RhaWx5L3N0b3JpZXMvMjAyMC8wOS8xMy9tb3JuaW5nLWJyZXctY3Jvc3N3b3JkLXN1Ym1pc3Npb24tZ3VpZGVsaW5lcz91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77Bd9bfd027?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://link.morningbrew.com/click/23199581.17679/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cubW9ybmluZ2JyZXcuY29tL2RhaWx5L3N0b3JpZXMvMjAyMC8wOS8xMy9tb3JuaW5nLWJyZXctY3Jvc3N3b3JkLXN1Ym1pc3Npb24tZ3VpZGVsaW5lcz91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77Bd9bfd027?utm_source%3Dmorning_brew&source=gmail&ust=1619902544872000&usg=AFQjCNEztggmU5POzsyKA3WaM4PpKMUEZQ" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Check out our tutorial</a>, and then be sure to submit. href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/04/29/stock-market-futures-open-to-close-news.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efull stonks\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in April. The S\u0026P increased more than 5%, the Dow 2.7%, and the Nasdaq 5.4%.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eUS economy: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHousehold income \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/consumer-spending-personal-income-march-2021-11619732790?mod=hp_lead_pos2\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esurged 21.1%\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in March, the largest monthly increase on record, thanks in large part to the $1,400 stimulus checks sent to most Americans.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGlobal economy: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe eurozone (all the countries that use the euro as a currency) slid into a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/e7152f72-2494-43fa-86fa-4a8236a4db12?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etechnical recession\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e last quarter, with GDP declining 0.6%. A recession = two consecutive quarters of negative economic growth. The US grew 1.6% comparatively.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nTECH\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/30/apples-airtags-go-sale?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nAirTag, Your Keys Are It\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Apple AirTag\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80OTMwL2FwcGxlX2FpcnRhZy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe smallest and least powerful item in Apple’s device lineup, the humble AirTag, went on sale yesterday. But techies \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/04/28/technology/personaltech/apple-airtag-review-tile.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eare hyped\u003c/a\u003e that this runt of the litter made its debut. Why? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor one, if second-gen iPod Shuffles taught us anything, it’s that sometimes Apple’s smallest, simplest products change our lives the most. The $29 AirTags attach to items via a $35 key ring (or off-brand option) to let iOS users quickly locate lost keys, wallets, and dogs (knock on wood x3). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSound familiar? That’s because Tile devices have been doing the same thing for about eight years. In fact, Tile’s CEO CJ Prober threw another \u003ca href=\"https://www.vox.com/recode/22395840/apple-airtags-tile-tracker-antitrust-regulators?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eantitrust allegation\u003c/a\u003e on Apple’s pile after AirTags were officially announced last week, requesting that Congress “take a closer look.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut if motivational posters are to be believed, it’s not what you do but how you do it. And Apple finds your dog differently than Tile does... \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIntroducing “ultra-wideband”\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGood for pandemic sweatpants; even better for locating lost items. While Tile finds devices using Bluetooth signals, each AirTag is equipped with an ultra-wideband chip that allows owners to track them down with \u003ca href=\"https://www.wired.com/story/apple-airtags-future-of-augmented-reality/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emuch more precision\u003c/a\u003e than Bluetooth can. Using an iPhone 11 or a later model, users will be able to see visual cues that let them know that, for instance, their phone isn’t just on the bed, but has nestled into the Neverland of their duvet. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhere things get even cooler: \u003c/strong\u003eThat kind of advanced location-finding could be the first ripple in a wave of new augmented reality. Bouncing all those signals between iOS devices and AirTags could create “a hidden digital layer” of the world, Stanford researcher Gordon Wetzstein told Wired. And that layer could make AR experiences, like playing \u003cem\u003ePokémon GO\u003c/em\u003e or having the Snapchat hot dog dance on your desk, more realistic. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eUltra-wideband may \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2021/01/05/tile-to-launch-to-launch-a-new-tracker-powered-by-ultra-wideband-technology/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enot stay unique\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to Apple, since Tile is reportedly working on its own device using the technology. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eApple hasn’t commented on the augmented reality possibilities of AirTags. However, AirTags were created using Apple’s AR-building software platform, ARKit, and the tech company’s shown interest in the space before: Just open your Measure app for an early example. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ While we’re here: \u003c/strong\u003eAirTags represent another instance of Apple building an ecosystem of products and services that work together in ways that could be construed as unfair. Yesterday, the EU issued \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2021/4/30/22407376/apple-european-union-antitrust-charges-app-store-music-competition-commission-margrethe-vestager?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eantitrust charges\u003c/a\u003e against Apple over its App Store collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn a typical weekend, social media platforms light up with highlights, commentary, and reactions to a full slate of English soccer games. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis weekend will be much quieter. The most powerful stakeholders in English soccer will \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/04/24/sports/soccer/soccer-racism-boycott.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eblack out\u003c/a\u003e their social media accounts to raise awareness over racism and harassment online. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThey include England’s top men’s and women’s soccer leagues, governing agencies like FIFA and UEFA, and broadcasters Sky Sports and BT Sport.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eOther leagues, including English cricket, Premiership Rugby, and lawn tennis, are also \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/sports/2021/04/30/soccer-social-media-blackout/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etaking part\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOnline abuse is rampant in European soccer, where Black players and female analysts are often the subjects of a flood of racist and sexist messages. The anti-racism group Kick It Out reported a \u003ca href=\"https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/kick-it-out-rise-reports-discrimination-football-a9702666.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e42% rise\u003c/a\u003e in reports of discrimination within professional soccer last season. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn February, executives of England’s top leagues sent a letter to Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey and Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg, asking them to \u003ca href=\"https://www.efl.com/news/2021/february/english-footballs-open-letter-to-social-media/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etake measures\u003c/a\u003e to stop the “relentless flow of racist and discriminatory messages” that breed on their platforms.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe social media blackout movement was sparked by former Arsenal star Thierry Henry, who deleted his social media accounts in March to take a stand against abuse.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS
